entry.title: Guy Cory-Wright | View from the Acting Chair | July 2024
entry.summary: This month we’re delighted to welcome our youngest member to the ONZ family and Wellington club. Our Chair, Sarah O’Sullivan gave birth to Isobel in July and we wish Sarah and her newly expanded whanau the very best and lots of rest – haha! Rest is seldom found in Sarah’s vocab but for the next […] Guy Cory-Wright | View from the Acting Chair | July 2024 first appeared on Orienteering New Zealand.

entry.title: 2024 WOC | Edinburgh, Scotland | 12-16 July
entry.summary: In late 2021 / early 2022 sprint WOC, specifically WOC2024, was named as an event that ONZ could target to really make a mark on the world stage. WOC2022 was thought of as a stage on the way to that goal, although visa and covid problems rather upset the apple cart for that one. Even in […] 2024 WOC | Edinburgh, Scotland | 12-16 July first appeared on Orienteering New Zealand.

entry.title: JWOC | Pilsen, Czechia | 1-6 July
entry.summary: What a successful JWOC. The anticipation was high beforehand, and Zefa Fa’avae winning 2nd place in the long event is our best ever placing in the forest terrain for the Junior World Orienteering Championships long event. It follows in the footsteps of Matt Ogden’s golden medal win in the forest terrain for the middle event […] JWOC | Pilsen, Czechia | 1-6 July first appeared on Orienteering New Zealand.

entry.title: Invitation to the Sunshine State champs
entry.summary: New Zealanders thinking of coming to the Australian Championships being held at Armidale on the Northern Tablelands of New South Wales at the end of September might be interested in also attending the Queensland Orienteering Championships being held on the preceding weekend, 21/22 September.This two day event will be held just north of Stanthorpe on […] Invitation to the Sunshine State champs first appeared on Orienteering New Zealand.

entry.title: Oceania 2025 | Embargoes & first Bulletin
entry.summary: Four days of Oceania racing, a warm-up weekend and two training days are being prepared by orienteering clubs of the lower North Island. The warm-up events are on 18-19 January in Taranaki, followed by training maps in the lead-up to the four official Oceania 2025 races from 24-27 January. Oceania 2025 is supported and sanctioned by both Orienteering […] Oceania 2025 | Embargoes & first Bulletin first appeared on Orienteering New Zealand.

entry.title: Taitonga Southern Champs | Waikaia | 7-8 February 2025
entry.summary: Waikaia! How fondly we all remember events from, it seems, the very distant past! Once regarded as the most technical O map in the country (no doubt that would be challenged now!) it’s seen many a lost or baffled orienteer. Last used for Southern Orienteering Week in 2017 (though, if the memory serves well, Godzone […] Taitonga Southern Champs | Waikaia | 7-8 February 2025 first appeared on Orienteering New Zealand.

entry.title: Nationals 2025 | 18-21 April 2025
entry.summary: Explore the diverse Canterbury region of the South Island for Easter 2025. All the New Zealand nationals championship events will be within 90 minutes of Christchurch International Airport. Join us for challenging orienteering across a variety of terrain with newly mapped areas. The nationals website is undergoing small updates but in the meantime we also have brief […] Nationals 2025 | 18-21 April 2025 first appeared on Orienteering New Zealand.

entry.title: Canterbury Schools & SISS | 7 – 8 September
entry.summary: After JWOCC & NZSSOC, we are excited to continue events for youth sport. The South Island Secondary Schools Championships (SISS) and the Canterbury Orienteering School festival weekend have combined for a two-day competition. This has something for everyone. You can choose to orienteer on your own in a competitive grade if you have orienteering experience; or […] Canterbury Schools & SISS | 7 – 8 September first appeared on Orienteering New Zealand.

entry.title: Taupō School’s Orienteering | Half-yearly report
entry.summary: A series of introductory orienteering sessions held mainly within schools has just been completed over term 2 for 13 schools in Taupo and surrounding areas. This is a good increase from 8 schools who took part in these sessions in 2023. Two of the new schools were Kura for which we made school maps with […] Taupō School’s Orienteering | Half-yearly report first appeared on Orienteering New Zealand.

entry.title: 2024 QLD MTBO Championships | 24-25 August
entry.summary: These events will be part of the National MTBO Series & include QLD Series roundsUpdate to BULLETIN 1 Lingering wet ground conditions in Ringtail Creek SF have meant that we have to relocate the Long Distance event on Sunday 25th August to an alternate location in Beerburrum East SF, adjacent to the new Middle Distance map. Details will […] 2024 QLD MTBO Championships | 24-25 August first appeared on Orienteering New Zealand.

entry.title: High Performance | Steering Group + Performance Leader positions
entry.summary: Orienteering New Zealand will be advertising for the new Performance Leader and Performance Steering Group positions on Monday. The roles are of huge strategic importance to orienteering as they will not only be responsible for the oversight and running of our High Performance Programme, but also will be instrumental in the creation of a new […] High Performance | Steering Group + Performance Leader positions first appeared on Orienteering New Zealand.

entry.title: Controller’s clinic | Nelson | 7-8 September
entry.summary: The course will be of interest to course planners, controllers and organisers who wish to update their skill-set, for all events from club events to national championships. It is a prerequisite to becoming an ONZ A or B grade Controller. Topics include the Function and tasks of the Controller; Event Organisation; Technical detail about the map, control sites and courses; SportIdent and timing; Complaints, […] Controller’s clinic | Nelson | 7-8 September first appeared on Orienteering New Zealand.

entry.title: King’s Birthday Weekend | A cheque finish!
entry.summary: Nelson Orienteering Club’s King’s Birthday Weekend event in Golden Bay was a roaring success, providing competitors from around the country and Australia with Challenging courses – and even the weather played its part. Feedback suggests that many local businesses had a welcome income boost with several providing vouchers and discounts.Collingwood Area school had a refreshments […] King’s Birthday Weekend | A cheque finish! first appeared on Orienteering New Zealand.

entry.title: Trewin on IOF Event Supervisory Board | 2024-26
entry.summary: We’re very pleased to see Oceania represented on the IOF- the Council elections took place at the IOF General Assembly on 15 July. Delegations from 39 member federations were present – either on site or through the hybrid meeting solution online, and Blair Trewin was elected onto the new IOF Supervisory Board. The board consists […] Trewin on IOF Event Supervisory Board | 2024-26 first appeared on Orienteering New Zealand.

entry.title: Sport NZ |Diversity, Equity & Inclusion survey results
entry.summary: The Sport NZ 2024 DEI Sector Workforce Survey report is out now. This report captures insights from 109 organisations and 1,425 people across the sector providing insights on the make-up and experiences of board members and employees working in the play, active recreation and sport. The 2024 reports shows that meaningful progress has been made across the sector […] Sport NZ |Diversity, Equity & Inclusion survey results first appeared on Orienteering New Zealand.

entry.title: WUOC begins in Bulgaria on Thursday
entry.summary: 249 athletes from 30 different nations have set the course for the southwestern corner of Bulgaria, where the 2024 FISU World University Orienteering Championships take place in and around the city of Bansko. The first championship race is the Individual Sprint on Thursday in Bansko, where a flat mix of park and urban terrain awaits […]

entry.title: Meet Our New Regional Development Officer
entry.summary: Please say hello to our new Regional Development Officer, Jack Hanafin! entry.title: Orienteering Australia is now a Company
entry.summary: Orienteering Australia has completed the transition from an incorporated body to a company limited by guarantee structure. Orienteering Australia is now a Company first appeared on Orienteering Australia.

entry.title: Triumph Over Terrain: The Unyielding Spirit of Champions at the 2024 World Orienteering Championship
entry.summary: The Irish Orienteering team has once again proven their exceptional skill and determination at the World Orienteering Championships 2024. entry.title: Board Operational Update
entry.summary: Major items to come out of the last Board meeting include approved Guidelines for Conducting Major Carnivals, approved additional rule changes to the ASOC rules and approved 2023 Annual Report of OA. Board Operational Update first appeared on Orienteering Australia.

entry.title: Alice Springs Masters Games
entry.summary: The Alice Springs Masters Games are rapidly approaching, 12 - 19 October 2024, and orienteering is one of the sports on offer (MTB-O and Foot-O). Register today to compete in Australia’s longest running Masters Games event. Alice Springs Masters Games first appeared on Orienteering Australia.

entry.title: WOC 2024 Recap and Results
entry.summary: Over the last week, from 12-16 July, our Aussies traveled to Edinburgh for WOC 2024 competing in individual sprints, sprint relays and knock-out sprints. WOC 2024 Recap and Results first appeared on Orienteering Australia.

entry.title: WOC 2024 Knock-Out Sprint: Analysis, Maps and Results
entry.summary: Tove Alexandersson (Sweden) and Riccardo Rancan (Switzerland) won the World Orienteering Championships (WOC) Knock-Out Sprint – the last race of the championships. Silver and bronze went to Karolin Ohlsson (Sweden) and Simona Aebersold (Switzerland) in the women’s class, and Jørgen Baklid (Norway) and Jonatan Gustafsson (Sweden) in the men’s class. While the men’s race was a ...

entry.title: Park Street Update: Events July 23-29
WOC: Rancan and Alexandersson KO Sprint Champions
entry.summary: Riccardo Rancan (SUI) and Tove Alexandersson (SWE) claimed the World Championship titles in Knock-Out Sprint Tuesday afternoon. Central Edinburgh welcomed the 72 athletes back from the qualification in the morning with heavy showers for the quarter finals before it eventually stopped raining for the semi finals later in the afternoon. Once again the centre of […]

entry.title: WOC: KO Sprint Qualifiers done – time for the finals!
entry.summary: The last day of World Orienteering Championships 2024 started Tuesday morning in western Edinburgh, where the Knock-Out Sprint Qualification took place. Located in a relatively flat residential area, qualification courses between 2,4 – 2,8 kilometers containing many short legs with constant route choice challenges awaited the athletes. All of them trying to make in into […]

entry.title: WOC 2024 Sprint Relay: Analysis by Course Setter Ackland
entry.summary: Graeme Ackland in the WOC 2024 course setting team has made a detailed analysis of the WOC Sprint Relay 2024, published here at WorldofO.com. – It was a very exciting race with lots of small errors and changes of lead, Ackland comments. The race analysis goes through the race and discusses the decisions points – this ...

entry.title: Follow IOF’s XXXII Ordinary General Assembly here
entry.summary: The XXXII IOF Ordinary General Assembly is held in a hybrid format on 15 July 2024 in Edinburgh, Scotland, from 11:00 to 15:00 local time (BST). You will be able to follow the stream from the GA in IOF LIVE. Find the agenda and more information about the XXXII IOF Ordinary General Assembly here.

entry.title: WOC 2024 Sprint Relay: Maps, Results and brief Analysis
entry.summary: Switzerland won the World Orienteering Championships (WOC) Sprint Relay after a very strong performance by Simona Aebersold on the last leg where she outran Sweden’s Tove Alexandersson, who was later disqualified for skipping a control. Finland took the second place with Norway in third. The two big favourites, Switzerland and Sweden, followed each other closely ...

entry.title: WOC: Switzerland back on the Sprint Relay throne after 10 years
entry.summary: Switzerland won an exciting sprint relay at World Orienteering Championships in Edinburgh on Sunday afternoon after a close battle with Sweden, who ended up disqualified. Instead, it was Finland who got the silver medals with Norway taking the bronze. Today’s sprint relay was run on the campus of Heriot-Watt University in the western part of […]

entry.title: WOC 2024 Sprint: Analysis, Maps and Results
entry.summary: The Scottish organizers served one of the most tricky World Orienteering Championships (WOC) Sprint races ever – and the Swedish duo Martin Regborn and Tove Alexandersson made the day a big Swedish success with two gold medals for Sweden. Alexandersson with her 20th WOC gold medal – Regborn with his first. Sweden dominated the results along ...

entry.title: WOC: Regborn and Alexandersson take first golds in Edinburgh
entry.summary: The first gold medals of World Orienteering Championships in Edinburgh went to Tove Alexandersson (SWE) and Martin Regborn (SWE) after the Sprint final on Friday afternoon. The glorious sunny weather from the morning’s qualification had continued and combined with today’s arena in the central park, Princess Street Gardens, created a perfect setting for today’s race. […]

entry.title: WOC 2024 kicked off with sprint qualification
entry.summary: The World Orienteering Championships 2024 were off to a great start Friday morning, where the Sprint Qualification was held in the Leith district in nothern Edinburgh. An assymetric street plan and artificial barriers created numerous challenges for the approx. 200 athletes trying their hand at getting into top 15 in their heat to qualify for […]

entry.title: WOC 2024: All You Need To Know
entry.summary: Fast-paced urban orienteering with challenging route choices is expected when the 2024 World Orienteering Championships (WOC) starts in Edinburgh, Scotland on Friday July 12th with the Sprint Qualification and Final. The championship – which is a sprint-only WOC – continues with the Sprint Relay on Sunday July 14th, and finally rounds off with the Knock-Out ...

entry.title: New Zealand sets records in Czechia at the Junior World Orienteering Championships
entry.summary: The New Zealand Junior orienteering team showed they can compete with the best in the world in navigation and terrain running at the Junior World Orienteering Championships in Czechia last week. Zefa Fa’avae, son of the world famous adventure racer Nathan Fa’avae, ran a near-perfect race to take the silver medal in the long distance […] New Zealand sets records in Czechia at the Junior World Orienteering Championships first appeared on Orienteering New Zealand.

entry.title: New friendships and learning at the IOF Young Leaders Academy 2024
entry.summary: 25 young orienteering leaders from around the world took were earlier this year selected to take part in the IOF Young Leaders Academy (YLA) 2024 in Italy in the beginning of July. YLA was organised for the first time in 2023, and its purpose is to support their talent and their competencies on key topics […]

entry.title: CX80 MTBO World Cup: Splittorff and Haga retain top places
entry.summary: With 5 races of the 9-race CX80 World Cup season now completed, Danish rider Nikoline Splittorff and the Finn André Haga continue to lead the standings. Both riders won one of the recent two races in Latvia; Splittorff was second in the other whilst Haga was third. Biggest improvement amongst the top six comes from […]

entry.title: World Orienteering Championships kick off in Scotland on Friday
entry.summary: The highlight of the year in the international orienteering calendar begins on Friday morning in Edinburgh, Scotland, when the 40th World Orienteering Championships get underway. It is a sprint-only World Championships, which await the athletes with three medal races: Sprint, Sprint Relay and Knock-Out Sprint in that order. As many as 45 nations are participating […]

entry.title: CX80 MTBO World Cup: Mixed Relay win for Lithuania
entry.summary: A strong Lithuanian team won by 2.55 over Italy, with Finland third, 3.13 down, in Latvia today. In an exciting race in mainly forested terrain with many small paths and some hills, on a bright but windy day, the lead changed several times. Martin Illig, riding for Austria 2, had a flyer on the first […]

entry.title: MTBO rising stars: Italian triple European junior champion wins U23 gold; second gold for Swiss rider
entry.summary: In the Long distance races, Iris Aurora Pecorari, Italy and Noah Rieder, Switzerland, won World Championship gold medals as the best U23 riders in the CX80 World Cup field. Rieder is also U23 Sprint champion. Pecorari, only 20 this year, won all three gold medals in the Junior European Championships in Poland in May. The […]

entry.title: MelBushO Rocks! Granite Hills, Sunday 14 July, South Morang
entry.summary: Enjoy a great introduction to orienteering in rocks at Granite Hills on Sunday 14 July. Online entry is open now! MelBushO Rocks! Granite Hills, Sunday 14 July, South Morang first appeared on Orienteering Victoria.

entry.title: JWOC: Switzerland and Finland claim relay golds
entry.summary: The Junior World Orienteering Championships 2024 ended with two exciting relays on Saturday morning in Czechia, where Switzerland and Finland claimed the gold medals. The terrain was similar to yesterday’s middle distance – moderately hilly with many contour details and plenty of forkings for the relay courses. The men were first out in the forest […]

entry.title: CX80 World Cup in MTBO: Sprint wins for Splittorff and Bettega
entry.summary: Dane Nikoline Splittorff extended her lead in the CX80 World Cup with a win by 51 seconds, while Italian Fabiano Bettega won the men’s race by 19 seconds. World Cup leader André Haga, Finland was third. The race doubled as this year’s U23 World MTBO Championships in Sprint, and gold medalists here were the Austrian […]

entry.title: JWOC Middle: Two golds for home nation Czechia
entry.summary: Home nation Czechia continued to impress, winning both gold medals as the more than 330 athletes ran the middle distance at the Junior World Orienteering Championships on Friday. Compared to Wednesday’s long distance, the middle distance terrain was more moderately hilly and with several short, technical legs and many contour details to keep track of. […]

entry.title: CX80 World Cup in MTBO: leaders geared up for second round

Almost all the top six in the men’s and women’s lists will be among the 114 riders from 15 nations taking part. A Mixed […]

entry.title: Vale – Bob Mouatt (OAM)
entry.summary: Orienteering Australia is saddened to learn of the passing of one of our former Presidents in Bob. Bob was a true icon of our sport. He was a leader, promoter, communicator, manager, organiser, planner, controller, competitor, and mentor. Bob gave so much to our sport as a passionate member of Orienteering ACT and with Orienteering Australia. Vale – Bob Mouatt (OAM) first appeared on Orienteering Australia.
